name: Jeff Szarek
text:
This course came recommended by some people at work. We set up a tee time the day before for Saturday. We traveled about 40 mins to the course. It was right off the highway into a gated golf community. Right from the start we were greeted by the staff. Upon entering the clubhouse, I was amazed at the initial set up of the course. My co-worker had to rent some clubs, at which they were very accommodating by giving him a brand new set of Nike Vapors. I had the Coverts 2.0 from the previous year and was impressed at the rentals they provided. We went to the driving range and then the putting green and we were off. Long story short, the course was AWESOME and the view was even better. We found ourselves stopping to take pictures and taking in the view (Which I rarely do on course). What I thought was to be a 6 hr round (because of our relax play at each hole) was a little over 4 hrs. This course is in my TOP 5 best courses I've played in my life, (I've played in the range of 50-60 different courses). I would recommend this course to anyone who enjoys a challenge, but also a forgiving course layout. The scenic views are something out of a movie which as to the relaxation of the game of golf. If you are ever in the area, you have to check out this course.

A big Thank You to the staff there at Cherokee Ridge who were some of the top notch personnel a course can have. Jonathan Watts, a Graduate of the Golf Academy of America Orlando, did not disappoint to the customer service and knowledge one would find at that school.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

Should you ignore this warning and give these people your money please do not forget anything of value in your cart. text: Someone at the Coosa Pines Golf Course stole cash from my husband's wallet today when he left it temporarily in the golf cart,and we highly suspect it was an employee. The grounds crew was standing right there when he got back to the cart to get his wallet, so he asked if they saw anything. A man who appeared to be the grounds crew manager got overly defensive and wouldn't give a straight answer about if he'd seen anything. It seems very suspicious, but we have no proof. That grounds crew manager's attitude of complete disregard for someone's else's property, proper customer service, or just simple manners is completely inappropriate anywhere in the vicinity of a gentleman's game. I do recommend not playing golf at this facility because even if an employee didn't steal, they made absolutely no effort to prevent theft or to help find the thief.

name: Tangy Bodie
text: My husband and 3 others drive over 1 hr to play this course. When they got there a lady was working the club house. They informed her that they had reserved a tee time at 12:30. She was soooo nasty to them. She threw her hand up to cut them off and informed them that there were no carts available for 30-40 mins. The guys were ok with this since they would hit the driving range up in the meantime. It was her holier than thou attitude that made them mad. The owner was contacted and he defended her saying she sometimes comes off as rude, he did however go speak to the men and offered them a Gatorade as compensation... Yes will deff not be back! But they did say the course was nice.

resp.text: The real story of this review is that Tangy Bodie whatever her name may be, wasn't even at the golf course.   This is more of a story of how she can attempt to extract extreme compensation for the threat of a bad review.  From the moment speaking with Alexis on the phone the conversation quickly became "what kind of compensation will you give me??"  Meaning she wanted me to refund over $ 160.00 in greens fees because of her threats of a poor review.   I went out to the course and spoke to the gentlemen about the incident.  They were delayed only 5 minutes from their tee time.  My worker could have had a cooler head dealing with customers, but an apology was made and the men appeared to be happy that I looked into the situation. I offered to buy them a round of beers as a friendly gesture.   I am more than willing to accept a one star review than cower to a person trying to extort money in lieu of a bad review.   Cumberland Lake GC is one of the finest golf courses in Birmingham at its price point.  And, we also have some very fine individuals working behind the counter.  Please judge for yourself.

Also, the course needs to use a colored tee system so that you can actually find the tees that you want to play. Overall, very disappointed that this course has gone way downhill in every way possible.

text: Nestling in a valley between two ridges of tree-covered hills, the up-market residential development of Limestone Springs can boast a championship golf course that is a delight from first to last. With unobtrusive villas skirting only a few holes, the course retains all the naturalness and tranquillity of this Appalachian foothills environment.

name: Chris Mahan
text: This is a beautiful place with upscale environment and friendly staff. They were incredibly busy, but made me feel like I was the most important person in the room. I don't play golf, but am seriously considering picking up the sport just to have an excuse to come back here on a regular basis.

name: J L
text: The overall experience was a bit of let down because I had heard so many good things about this course. I traveled more than an hour away as well as the friends I invited and was pretty embarrassed by the conditions of the greens. I could see how this place would be beautiful if it was well maintained but every green had some sort of sun damage or grass issues. The temporary greens were not even cut so it was as if you were putting in the rough. The water coolers had no ice and we never once saw a cart asking if we wanted anything. Im writing an honest review so that others won't have the same bad experience that I did. I hope they fix things because the overall scenery is beautiful

name: T Garrett Neill
text: Mixed feelings.  At one time, one of the top courses in the state, and certainly my favorite.  Played today for the first time in a while, and although the course is nice, it is NOT the experience and condition that it once was.  It appears that they are working hard, but the edges are a bit rough.  Greens good, but slow.  Carts have been allowed to go almost anywhere.  It's a bit like the local good ol' boys have taken over.  I played behind 4 groups of 5 apiece, playing their own ball.  Took about 4:40 to play 18 as a single.  No chance of playing through or an offer to.  Should not have 5somes.  Staff was nice, decent food.  Fortunately,  I came on a Monday for a $50 rate.  If it was weekend it would have been $90!  Tough to justify driving an hour from Hoover.  I will play here again, but not motivated to try again quickly.

name: Dave The Golfer
text:
This is an okay Municipal course.

I don't know what the 5 stars are for....how can you give something 5 stars. So then what about the better courses? There are no options for more stars if we're comparing golf course to golf course...

This is my first time playing this course. I figured after all the "great" reviews, I'd try it out. One word: disappointment. I found this course on GolfNow for $40 for morning rounds and $26 for afternoon rounds. I booked my tee time on their last-updated-2012 website and it said $35. I don't know why it would be more on GolfNow...

Anyways, I guess if you didn't include the cart, it would be a decent price for the golf course. It's a nice golf course to just mess around and start learning golf. I can see myself having fun if I'm messing around with my friends trying to outdrive each other over a beer or two... But I don't know if I can take this course too seriously.

The pro shop employee wasn't really all that friendly either...no good morning, no welcome.... Just a sign here and an 'appreciate it'. Maybe it was too early in the morning for him.

Greens consistently have ball marks. They're pretty fresh too so I'm assuming the management doesn't enforce this. I must've repaired 3-4 per hole until I got fed up with it by hole 7.

The distances seem inconsistent...so maybe a calibration is needed?

The course lacks creativity, the greens are inconsistent, some are dying, more pot holes on paths than the NJ Turnpike, bare ground everywhere near greens and tees. Yeah....i don't know if I'm coming back and paying as much as I did to play here. The Robert Trent Jones golf course is about $20 more on GolfNow deals...

Like I said in the beginning, it's a 2-star golf course. I don't know what people review for, but I tried to mix both experience and the golf course itself.

Sorry Jimmy, I don't know where you see the great condition on this course...

name: Nathan Wright
text: Fun nine hole course that reminded me of the courses I grew up playing. For being closed a year, the course was in great shape. Greens were receptive and I know it will only keep improving under the new management.  The course is setup to make you hit a lot of shots and its important to keep it in play with all the trees that line the fairways. I certainly recommend getting out and supporting your local public courses. Excited to keep playing there on my trips to Fort Payne!

name: Mark Ethan Ford

A great local course to get 9 holes in. The greens can be spotty at times. During the rainy season, there are a few areas with poor drainage, but overall a good course to play and it is very reasonably priced.

Staff is friendly and a reserved tee time is only required on the weekends. Grounds have been improved over the last year. Several tee boxes still have depressions that should be filled in and the greens are painfully hard in the fall, but it is decent entertainment for the cost.

text: The course was in great shape for fall/winter ! I was really impressed with the conditions of the greens ! Cant wait to play there again !

name: Bruce Phillips (CBruceGO!)
text: I just played this course today with my Son.  This was my Son's first time playing golf with me, and a first for both of us playing at this course.  Coming out of Spring the fairways and greens are in better shape than expected, but still improving.  We only chose to play nine holes, due to time constraints, but if I had known how lite the fairway traffic would be on a Wednesday at 11a.m., we could have easily played a full eighteen holes.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. My only complaint was the fact that they were watering several greens and fairways at noon.  We had to bypass three fairways due to this inconvenience.  All and all, a nice course for the price.  $24 w/cart for 18  and $20 w/cart after 3pm. twilight golf.   Two water holes, not counting the sprinklers, and no sand traps.  Long fairways.  Several of the greens have tricky little lines to make your short game a bit more fun and challenging.  Once in shape I could easily rate this course a four maybe even a five for the great price.  I will definitely play this course again soon.

name: Evan Mitchell
text: Way too many golfers every time you go. No tee times took 45mins to tee off behind 20 people and they will not let you start play on the back nine, you have to wait at every tee box on the group in front of you every time. I like the course but they really need tee times.

Not as pretty as the challenging golf courses, with treed fairways, but this course is perfect for those working on their games.

Not a dealbreaker but a tad irritating nonetheless.
